loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en:
Mrs.Byambaa is a 50-year-old widow who lives with her two daughters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her two daughters go to the secondary school, while Byambaa has been working as a veterinary doctor for 11 years. She also learned tailoring in Oyu-tolgoi project's tailoring course in 2011 and has been tailoring her and her daughters' clothes since then.

Byambaa is now planning to establish a tailoring business, and so is requesting a 2,000,000MNT loan to purchase equipment and inventory and pay the initial rent of her work premises. She is a hardworking and friendly woman who says, "My short-term goal is to increase my income and save money for my children's further education. They will be enrolling in university by next year."

loans.use: To purchase equipment and inventory and pay the rent of her workplace premises.

loans.name: Shemsije

texts.en:
Shemsije is fifty-one years old. She comes from the Ashklai community, and is the mother of four children between the ages of 11 and 25.  Her husband works as a taxi driver; she is a housewife.

Shemsije has always wanted to see her house beautiful, but never had the chance to renovate. She is now requesting 1000 euros as a loan in order to do these renovations. This loan will help her to improve the living conditions for her and her family.
 
Her goal is to give her children the best future, and to save money for them. 

She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Donata

texts.es: Donata, de 53 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Ezequiel, su esposo desde hace 32 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 6 de ellos en su casa propia. Gracias a la colaboración de su esposo y ella, lograron obtener todo los logros que ahora tienen. La casa y estabilidad económica, Ella se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de maíz, habas y papa en terrenos propios y alquilados. Todas las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de sus alimentos, cuenta que dentro de poco cosechará papa de la variedad “yungay”. Donde espera obtener buenas ganancias, además de ser conocida entre los comerciantes mayoristas, quienes en ocasiones van a sus mismas chacras para comercializar su alimentos enteros. Ahora desea incrementar sus siembra y poder obtener buenas ganancias para comprarse más terrenos agrícolas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Manos fuertes” y este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda económica para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Donata; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de peones para que puedan arar la tierra y comenzar la siembra.
texts.en:
Donata, 53 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with Ezequiel, her husband for 32 years. They have eight children together, of which only six of them live in their own home. Because she and her husband worked together, they were able to obtain all the achievements they now have, the house and financial stability. 

She works in agriculture, growing corn, beans and potatoes on their own and rented land. Every morning she works caring for her crop, that soon will soon yield the type of potato called “yungay,” and which she hopes will bring good income. Furthermore, since she is known by the wholesalers, sometimes they come to the farms to market the entire product. 

Now she wants to increase her planting in order to obtain good earnings so they can buy more farmland. She belongs to the solidarity group “Manos fuertes” (Strong Hands) and this is her fifth loan through MFP, where she feels established, and she gets financial help in order to get ahead in her business. Therefore, she promises to be punctual with her payments. 

Donata will invest the requested funds in the payment of laborers so they can begin plowing and sowing.

loans.use: to pay laborers in order to begin plowing and sowing her crops

loans.name: Zulema De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Estimados señores de kiva, doña Zulema tiene un negocio donde brinda servicio de gimnasio, actividad comercial que tiene dos años de estar funcionando.
Ella estudio la carrera de administración de empresas, y por iniciativa propia tuvo la idea de crear su propia microempresa, en donde obtiene ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.
Actualmente necesita la suma de  $417, para comprar una máquina para realizar ejercicios, con la que pretende ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Antes de poner su negocio ella estudiaba en la universidad administración de empresas.
Su estado civil es soltera, y vive con su mama.
texts.en:
Zulema has a gym and sells gym services. She has owned and operated this business for 2 years.  She studied business administration and had the idea of starting a small business so that she could earn an income and help pay her family's expenses.

She now needs $417 so that she can buy an exercise machine in order to offer better service to her customers.  Before starting this business, she studied business administration at the university.  She is a single woman and lives with her mother.

loans.use: to buy exercise machines and to remodel the gym.

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es:
Señores kiva, presento ante ustedes a la señora Martha, comerciante de un puesto de abarrotería y productos de consumo humano, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esta labor, siendo una madre ejemplar que colabora junto con su esposo con los gastos de su hogar,
Antes de tener su negocio, ella vendía carne de cerdo y elaboraba nacatamales, un producto alimenticio en la comida de los nicaragüenses.
Para brindar una mejor atención y tener una variedad de productos, ella necesita $834 para diversificar y poder abastecer la demanda en esta temporada navideña.
El crédito lo cancelara a un plazo de un año, con abonos quincenales.
Es importante mencionar que doña Martha es una persona honesta y de valores cristianos.
Su estado civil es casada y con dos hijos en edad escolar
texts.en:
Kiva, we present to you Martha, a vendor at a stall of groceries and human consumption products. For twelve years she has been dedicated to this work, being an example mother who collaborates with her spouse with the household bills.

Before having her business, she sold pork and made nacatamales, a food product in the food of Nicaraguans. To provide better attention and to have a variety of products, she needs $834 to diversify and to be able to meet demand in this Christmas season.

The loan will be repaid in one year, with fortnightly payments. It is important to note that Martha is an honest person with Christian values. She is married and has two school age children.

loans.use: To buy basic grains like rice, beans, sugar and maize.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia , él se dedica al cultivo de frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener siempre la mejores cosechas, el terreno esta en un lugar accesible apto para el cultivo y con suelo fértil, todo lo que produce lo comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además se caracteriza por tener el mejor servicio; José es un hombre decidido, responsable y muy trabajador, tiene muchas metas para el futuro y con empeño y constancia piensa alcanzarlas, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le s solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de frijol, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. José Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago y esta muy contento con la ayuda asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: José Antonio, 42 years old, lives along with his life partner and their children in their own house. He is dedicated to farming beans. He has various years experience working in farming and he has a lot of valuable experience that allows him to always obtain better harvests. The land is in an accessible place suitable for farming and, with fertile soil, everything he produces he sells in the areas near the community. He already has a lot of customers since people know that everything he sells is of top quality and at good prices. Additionally, he's known for having the best service. Jose is a decisive, responsible and hard working man. He has a lot of goals for the future and, with effort and perseverance, he believes he'll achieve them. In the last planting season, he had some losses and he wants to recuperate but he does not have enough capital so he is requesting from Integral a loan that allows him to buy bean seed, herbicide, fertilizer, tools, etc. Jose Antonio has good payment references and is very happy with the help to settle the debt and at the same time offer his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, herbicide, fertilizer and tools.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married lady, age 39. She has four children between the ages of 15 and six. She runs a cafeteria business, which has been in operation for four years and earns her an income of 5,000 KES monthly.

She is now requesting her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD. She wishes to purchase rice, cooking oil, and bales of maize flour for her cafeteria business. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. In the future Anne wishes to start a retail shop and also expand her current business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, cooking oil, and maize flour

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo de sesenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a compañera de vida y sus en casa propia; él se dedica a la venta de variedades bancos plásticos, hamacas, escobas, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucho experiencia en la venta que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia desde un puesto en el mercado de la localidad, es muy conocido y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Bernardo se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y honestidad, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y con muchas ganas de alcanzar sus sueños, dia a dia se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo por que sabe que así logrará su objetivo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar escobas, hamacas, bancos plásticos trapeadores, etc. Bernardo tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y ala vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Bernardo, 69 years old, lives with his wife and theirs in their own house. He is dedicated to selling a variety of plastic stools, hammocks, brooms, among other things. He has various years experience with the business and this has awarded him much experience in selling which permits him to obtain the best earnings. He sells from a stall in the local market. He is well known and he has won a lot of customers who prefer him for the quality, the good prices and, above all, the excellent service. Bernardo is known for his great friendliness and honesty. He is an entrepreneurial man, dedicated to his work and with many desires to achieve his dreams. Day after day, he works to the maximum in his job because he knows he'll achieve his goals this way. In the last weeks demand has increased and he wishes to take advantage and make a new investment. For this he requested from Integral a loan that allows him to buy brooms, hammocks, plastic stools, mops, etc. Bernardo has good payment references and impeccable morals. He assures that he will be able to repay the debt and, at the same time, he trust that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy brooms, hammocks, plastic stools, mops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread pans and industrial mixers

loans.name: Enhbat

texts.en: Enhbat is 42 years old and lives with his three children and wife in a small house in Govi-Altai province in Mongolia. His oldest son is a university student and his two younger children are high school students. His wife buys pelts at a local market. Enhbat started his business with his wife by reselling raw materials from livestock since 2000. He buys these raw materials from livestock from the countryside and sells them in Ulaanbaatar city. In 2008, he bought a car to purchase pelts from the countryside at lower prices and supply them to manufacturers at higher prices. He is planning to expand his business in the near future in order to improve his family's living condition. He is a hardworking and honest person who says, "My two children are growing up and will soon go to college. Thus, I want to save money for their education in advance." He is now requesting a 3,900,000 MNT loan to cover his son's tuition and other school-related expenses.

loans.use: to cover his son's tuition and other school-related expenses.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 57 years old, married and the mother of three children who are all adult (between 31 and 16 years of age). She sells cereals and has been in operation for a period of 20 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000.  

She is servicing her second loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET after she paid the previous loan back successfully, and intends to purchase dry maize and beans for resale.  

The anticipated amount will be put back into the business and used to repay the loan. Her dream is to enable her children to attain a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase dry beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Oscar y sus hijos; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; María es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y con muchas metas por delante, su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito es la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. María Isabel tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Isabel is thirty-five years old. She lives with her life companion, Oscar, and her children. 

She has a store where she sells stables, such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items. She has been in this business for many years and this has given her sales experience that permits her to obtain the best earnings. It is located in her home in a busy neighborhood, which gives her many customers, the people preferring her because she always has the good quality product they need, at good prices and with an unequaled service to the customer’s order.

María is a woman dedicated to her work, she is energetic and has goals to get ahead. Her biggest secret to success is persistence and love of work that is the only way to achieve what you want. Like all good merchants, she wants to increase her business and to make new investments but she needs capital and this is why she is asking Integral for a loan that will permit her to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.

María Isabel has good payment references, she vouches that she can pay the debt and she also hopes that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread and drinks to sell in her home-based business

loans.name: Khaukharkul

texts.ru: Хаухаркул 53 года, воспитывает одного сына.Хаухаркул Замужем они с мужем работают в больнице. Хаухаркул с мужем  качестве основного источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Начатое 29 лет назад со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство имеет на сегодня 3 дойные коровы, теленок, бычок, 55 голов овец и 2 лошади, семья обрабатывает 1,5 га орошаемой земли. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Хаухаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы Хаухаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйство и улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en: Khaukharkul is 53 years old, married, and has one son. She and her husband work in a hospital, but the main source of the family's income is from the work Khaukharkul and her husband do in animal husbandry and growing crops. They began 29 years ago with a start-up sum of 10,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS). Today their farm includes 3 dairy cows, a calf, a bull, 55 head of sheep and 2 horses, and the family also works 1.5 hectares of irrigated land. Their monthly income from their farm is around 15,000 KGS. For the purpose of further developing her business, Khaukharkul has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy bulls. She plans to re-invest the income generated by the loan into further developing her business and improving her housing conditions.

loans.use: To buy bulls and sheep

loans.name: Lodoi

texts.en:
Mr Lodoi is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife Myagmarjargal, 31, who just gave birth to their second daughter, stays home to care for their children.

Lodoi has been running a business transporting goods back and forth between the provincial center and the Chinese border, importing rice, flour and other groceries. Having thus established an extensive network, he is now starting his own grocery store near his home, well-located near schools and without competition within the area. A hardworking and honest man, Lodoi is requesting a 2,000,000MNT loan to purchase inventory for his new grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his new grocery store business.

loans.name: Fedor

texts.ru:
Федор живет в городе Бердянске. Он зарабатывает на жизнь тем, что предоставляет населению компьютерные услуги, а также занимается продажей вторсырья, макулатуры и пластика. Тем не менее, основной деятельностью Федора являются компьютерные услуги по созданию и оформлению сайтов для заказчиков, настройки шаблонов, хостинг и домены, а также составление рекламы на сайтах. Федор занимается этим бизнесом уже более 5 лет. Работает на дому. Успел зарекомендовать себя как программист, всегда предоставляющий качественные услуги. Бизнес развит на высоком уровне. 
Федор обратился в КИВА за суммой в 16 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить мультимедийное оборудование для своей рабочей студии, а именно: камеру для съемок, внешнюю звуковую карту, микшеры, а также мультимедийный компьютер на 4 ядра. В дальнейшем Федор хотел бы развиваться профессионально, приобретая еще более технологически усовершенствованное оборудование и разрабатывая новые сайты.
texts.en:
Fedor lives in the city of Berdyansk.  He earns his living by offering computer services to the public.  He also sells recycled materials, waste paper, and plastic.  Nonetheless, Fedor's primary business is creating and executing websites to order, customizing templates, hosting, and domains, as well as writing internet ads.  Fedor has been in this business for five years.  He works from home. He has proven himself as a programmer who always offers quality services.  His business is developed to a high degree. 

Fedor has turned to Kiva for 16,000 hryven (UAH) in order to buy multimedia equipment for his work studio, namely a camera, external sound card, mixers, as well as a multimedia computer with a 4-core processor.  Going forward, Fedor would like to develop himself professionally, acquiring even more technologically advanced equipment and developing new websites.

loans.use: to buy multimedia equipment for his studio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on an assortment of barrettes, elastics, hair accessories, picture frames, batteries, stationery, and school supplies

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze lives in Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He carries out quarrying and sells building stones to construction sites. He began the business from the capital he received when he was previously employed on the same site.

Mbodze learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is lack of customers at certain seasons of the year.

Mbodze is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase stones and and renovate the business site. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase stones and and renovate the business site.

loans.name: Salkyn

texts.ru: Салкын 62 года,замужем. Они с мужем вырастили и воспитывали 6 детей. Дети Салкын уже взрослые и каждый занят собственной семьёй.Они с мужем оба на пенсии. По характеру Салкын человек очень трудолюбивый,спокойный и открытый. Салкын в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Начатое 37 лет назад со стартовой суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство имеет на сегодня 3 голов КРС и 6 голов МРС.  Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салкын обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец, Для последующего откорма и продажи. Доходы Салкын планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и иметь возможность улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en: Salkyn is 62 years old and married, and she and her husband are now pensioners. They have raised 6 children who are now adults and busy with their own families. Salkyn is a hard-working, patient and open-hearted woman. As the main breadwinner of the family, she raises cattle and grows crops. Having started 37 years ago with a sum of only 3,000 Som (KGS), her farm now includes 3 head of cattle and 6 head of smaller livestock. The monthly income from the farm is 6,000 KGS. Salkyn has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS for the purpose of further developing her business. She plans to buy sheep to fatten and sell. Salkyn will use the income generated by this loan to further expand her business and to have the opportunity to improve her housing conditions.

loans.use: To purchase sheep for fattening and future resale

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan lives in Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He carries out quarrying and sells building stones to construction sites. He began the business from the capital he received when he sold one of his goats. The business has been running for twenty years.

Duncan learned about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is lack of customers at certain seasons of the year.

Duncan is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to purchase slabs from other quarries to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to diversify into the dairy business by buying two cows.

loans.use: To purchase slabs from other quarries to sell.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhjargal is a 42-year-old woman who lives with her husband, three sons and a daughter in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt. Her husband is 42 years old and works as an assistant worker at a construction company. Her oldest son studies at university, her other two sons are secondary school students, and her daughter goes to kindergarten. Mrs. Enkhjargal started her business in 2004 by selling meat from a rental counter at the local market. After that she began working as an interior designer during summers. In winters, she sells coal and firewood, and she produces and sells block stone. She needs 2,000,000 MNT to pay her son's university tuition fee. She is a hardworking and friendly woman.

loans.use: To pay her son's university tuition fee

loans.name: Ivica

texts.en:
Ivica is part of a vulnerable population. He is married and has two children, ages seven and ten. Ivica makes a living by selling fast food such as sandwiches, kebabs, etc. He is a hardworking man and started his business three years ago. The location is near the school and his customers are mostly students. Ivica is a charismatic and hardworking man who makes delicious food.

His menu focuses on light and fast meals, and he makes a good income since he always has customers. He is requesting this loan to buy inventory, including tables and chairs, for his food stand. Through this business he hopes to offer a better quality of life to his family. His goal is to save money for the future and secure a better education for his children. Ivica is very thankful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for his food stand

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr: Madame Haby est une femme veuve qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis 12 ans et gère une cantine ou elle vend pommes de terre, oignons et autres produits alimentaires. Elle commence sa journée de travail a 8h et arrête son activité a 14 h. Elle soutient sa famille et prend en charge les factures d’eau et d’électricité en plus de la dépense quotidienne. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit de100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits alimentaires (boissons fruits) destinées a la vente. Son objectif est de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise. Ainsi elle souhaite augmenter ses bénéfices dans le but de pouvoir supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants. SON PROJET FUTUR CONSISTE A OUVRIR UN GRAND MAGASIN ET DEVENIR UN GROSSISTE.
texts.en: Haby is a widow who lives in Senegal. She has been trading for the past 12 years and manages a shack where she sells potatoes, onions and other food products. She begins her day at 8 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 2 o'clock in the afternoon. She supports her family and takes care of the water and electricity bills as well as daily expenses. She is a member of one of UIMCEC's branches where she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs, with which she is going to buy food products (drinks, fruits) to sell. Her aim is to diversify the products she sells and thus increase her profits so that she can pay for her children's schooling. Her plan for the future is to open a large shop and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: José De Jesús

texts.en:
José de Jesús is a farmer and the primary cheese producer within his dairy collective. Due to the amount of heat required to make the cheese, he currently spends significant amounts of money on non-renewable LP gas. 

Using his 40-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will treat his dairy cow manure to produce clean-burning biogas, displacing the fossil fuel he is currently using. The resultant fertilizer will be used on the animal feed - alfalfa and maize. 

This loan represents 34% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 40-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio represents the future of farming of his rapidly-urbanizing town. He is dedicated to improving yields while reducing his environmental impact. With his 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Julio will process the waste produced by his hogs to generate renewable biogas and organic fertilizer, displacing natural gas, firewood, and agrochemical fertilizer usage. 

This loan represents 93% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, 30, is a mother of three children. She is married and lives in Buchanan. Her children are between the ages of three and seven - one lives with her and the other two live with their aunt. 

Betty has a table in the market where she has been selling for the past fifteen years. She sells chains, earrings and lappers (local cloth). She learned to sell from her aunt. Because of the way she interacts with her customers, and the quality material that she sells, she makes profits every day. One of the difficulties that she faces is lack of commodities. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappers, chains and earrings to increase her sales. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more lappers, chains and earrings to increase her sales.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married with six children; three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a brother). She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. She generates additional income through rental rooms. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to go villages to sell green bananas. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Sabile

texts.en:
Sabile lives in the Ashkali community in Kosovo. She is married and has four children between the ages of three and eleven years old. Three of the children currently attend school. Her husband works in construction. Like all members of the Ashkali community, her family lives in unacceptable conditions. 

They are in urgent need of renovating her house, before the quickly approaching winter season, as it well known that winters in Kosovo are very cold. Sabile needs a loan in order to buy gravel and cement and to put the facade on her house. She hopes in the near future to change the main door of her house as well. 

Her goal is to improve the living conditions for her family. She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy gravel and cement and to put the facade on her house.

loans.name: Jacinter

texts.en:
Jacinter lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which lies in the northern part of the Rift Valley. She has three children and has been doing this work for three years. Her primary income sources are eggs, crops and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'She enjoys selling eggs and poultry.!' Her biggest challenge is 'Cleaning the poultry house. The animal in the farm is named 'Wengi'. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds.

Jacinter was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because of good savings and low interest rates.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'She learned how to save and plan for money.'

Her highest monthly expense is business-related. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Jacinter replied 'By getting eggs for sale and improving the family business.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jacinter owns the following: 'poultry, bicycle, motorcycle' but does not own 'cow, pig, pump, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD' but does not have 'running water'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. She has four children and has been doing this work for two years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and personal business.

She says what she finds most enjoyable about farming: 'Feeding of the poultry and sale of eggs.!' Her biggest challenge is 'Prevention of diseases..' The animal in the farm is named 'Furaha.'. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds.

Esther was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because of monthly loan repayment and low interest.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Its very important to save because it helps in future income for the family.'

Her highest monthly expense is business-related. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Esther replied 'By getting more eggs for sale and improving family income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Esther owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, sewing machine, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 41 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de una de sus 2 hijas: Any a la que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres hace 15 años. Posee 8 vacas de buena calidad, además de 80 ovejas a los que cuida con mucha dedicación, pues antes que el sol alumbre ella lleva a sus animales a las altura de su pueblo, donde puede encontrar mejores pastos naturales para su alimentación, su esfuerzo es recompensando cada vez que comercializa la leche que producen las vacas, pues obtiene varios litros por día, tanto que pierde la cuenta que cuantos litros vende a una empresa procesadora que llega todos los días a su casa. Paralelo a su trabajo también siembra al partir en sociedad y de manera independiente, pues es otra de las actividades que le genera buenas ganancias. Ahora ella desea aumentar su ganado de ovejas, ya que tiene un comprador y no desea quedarse sin animales para seguir la reproducción. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mujeres yanamarquinas” y este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda económica para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Gloria, invertirá el dinero en la compra de más cabezas de ganado en principal ovejas de calidad.
texts.en:
Gloria, 41, is a hardworking woman. She lives with one of her two daughters, Any, whom she cares for in the house that she inherited from her parents 15 years ago. 

She has 8 good quality cows, as well as 80 sheep that she cares for with dedication. Before the sun rises, she takes her animals to the heights above her village, where they can find the best natural pastures for grazing. Her effort is rewarded every time she markets the milk produced by her cows. She obtains several liters a day, so much that she loses count of how many liters she sells to a processing company that comes to her house every day. 

Along with her work, she plants crops as part of a group as well as independently, which also generates a good income. Now she wants to increase her herd of sheep, as she now has a buyer and does not want to be left without any animals to breed.

She belongs to the group Mujeres Ynamarquinas and this is her second loan with MFP, where she feels she has developed, now that she has obtained financial aid to grow her business. She promises to be timely with her payments. Gloria will invest the money in buying more livestock, mainly quality sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia, 30, lives in Buchanan with  her  husband and three children. Her children are between the ages of three and 15 and attend school, while her husband is a driver.

For the past fifteen years, she has been selling coal by retail in her community. One of the difficulties she faces is the low sales during the raining season. She makes profit when she sells, because she is the only one that sells coal by retail in her community. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of coal to sell by retail. Her plan is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal to sell by retail.

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.ru:
За счет последнего кредита от КИВА Евгения увеличила количество электротоваров на своей точке, купила розетки, переходники и т.д. Дополнительная прибыль помогает Евгении оплачивать учебу ее двух сыновей в вузах. 
Евгении потребовалась сумма в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить книги, электротовары, календари.  Хороший ассортимент привлекает покупателей и соответственно увеличивается доход.
texts.en: Yevgeniya used her last Kiva loan to increase the amount of electrical goods, such as sockets and converters, that she sells at her outlet. The extra income generated helps her to pay for the post-secondary education of her two sons. Yevgeniya is now seeking a loan of 15,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to buy books, electrical goods, and calendars. A good variety of products attracts customers, which in turn increases income.

loans.use: to buy books, electrical goods, and calendars

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional retail stock of toothpaste.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana es una madre muy responsable y dedicada a su hogar, con grandes deseos de mejorar en la vida, ella vive en casa propia junto a su único hijo quien se dedica a estudiar. Ana trabaja muy duro comercializando frutas de estación en el mercado, en donde desde hace mucho años realiza esta actividad, creciendo poco a poco. Debido a que en la actualidad las necesidades son mayores, ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor variedad de frutas de estación y así mismo comprarlas por mayor para obtenerlas a menores precios y así obtener mayores ganancias. Ana tiene muchas esperanzas en este préstamo ya que espera mejorar en gran manera.
texts.en:
Ana is a mother who is very responsible and dedicated to her home, with a great desire to improve in life. She lives in her own house with her only son who is a student. 

Ana works hard selling seasonal fruits in the market, where she has done this for many years, growing little by little. Because her needs are now greater, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, with which she can buy a greater variety of seasonal fruits wholesale at lower prices and thus make better profits. Ana has high hopes for this loan as she hopes to improve greatly.

loans.use: to buy onions, cucumbers, green chilies, tomatoes, and yucca.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, who lives in Malindi, Kenya, is a water vendor. He is a married father of five school-going children. He supplies water to his neighborhoods; this idea came from the fact that there is a lack of of water delivery in the area. His water business has been running for ten years.

Besides this, he also owns rental houses and is employed at an international hotel along the coastline. He plans to diversify to other sources of income, specifically transportation.

A loan of 83,450 Kenya Shillings will help John buy a motorcycle for his business. Apart from the high cost of living that has reduced the disposable income of many customers to such businesses, John intends to purchase more motorcycles in the future and provide employment to other people.

He believes the income from the business will improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita lives in Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married business lady who owns a retail shop which she has been operating for four years. In this business, Anita sells bread, soft drinks, milk, utensils, etc. She is also employed.
Anita learned about Milango through a friend and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve business operations. The challenges she faces include price fluctuations and effects of the low season. 
Anita is applying for a loan of 75,150 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock, e.g. soap, sugar, plastic utensils, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to start a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 24 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Aiza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Aiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives Kongowea area of Coast province. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She owns a tailoring shop which she has been operating for seven years. 
She leared about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges facing her business include the seasonal business climate and bad debts.
Eunice is applying for a loan of 75,150 Kenya shillings to purchase fancy clothes, materials for making clothes, etc. She intends to use part of the extra income from the business to promote her business and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fancy clothes, materials for making clothes, etc.

loans.name: Mahoulome 9 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOULOME 9 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies vivant dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupe, Jeanne, celle dont la main est levée sur la photo est âgée de 42 ans. Jeanne est mariée à un certain Jean-Marie et a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assure ensemble les différentes charges. Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Jeanne vend de l’huile de palme et des vins de palme à son domicile. Il y a environs quinze ans que Jeanne exerce cette activité. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. En vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, Jeanne ambitionne agrandir son stock de vente; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOULOME 9, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The MAHOULOME 9 group is made up of three friends living in the same village. Jeanne (who is raising her hand in the photo) is the group's representative. She is 42 years old and married to a man named Jean-Marie. She has six children, all of whom live in the care of their parents and have received schooling. The couple lives together with their children, and both Jeanne and Jean-Marie participate in covering the various expenses. Jeanne did not go to school.

Jeanne sells palm oil and palm wines from her home. She has been running this business for about 15 years now. She stocks up in a region in Benin.

Jeanne is trying to increase her stock of goods for sale in order to raise the level of her business. Doing so will allow her to better meet the demand of her customers. That is why Jeanne, along with the other members of the MAHOULOME 9 group, is seeking a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy cans of palm oil

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a green grocer, a business which she has been operating for 6 years. She started the business from the income she received while selling buns. Her main challenge is the high cost of transport while sourcing for the goods. 

Josephine learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. She is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and fruits wholesale. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to construct a rental house and improve on the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits wholesale.

loans.name: Medorie

texts.en:
Medorie is 50 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Medorie has a general store business in the Philippines. Medorie requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional grocery items like soap, snack foods, and other groceries.

Medorie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Medorie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items like soap, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 400 more chicks, materials to construct the chicken stall, and rice in a large quantity.

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
Jojie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport business.

Jojie has been in this business for 3 years. Jojie earns more income from fish vending.

Jojie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural produce (i.e. peanuts, corn, bananas, green beans, pumpkin, vegetables, etc.)

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa de 53 años de edad, trabaja como comerciante de productos varios y de primera necesidad, es soltera y vive sola, por lo que se dedica de lleno a su negocio en el que se encarga de comercializar ropa para mujeres, cremas, perfumes, maquillajes y otros productos de belleza, los cuales comercializa en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante con vecinos, recomendados y amigos. Rosa es una persona muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza para contar con el sustento diario y con todo lo esencial para su hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con la intención de contar con el dinero necesario para la compra de diferentes tipos de ropa como blusas, faldas, pantalones y otros, así mismo para invertir en la compra de bolsos, carteras, y cosméticos, con esto Rosa cumplirá con todos los pedidos realizados y al mismo tiempo contara con nuevo productos para ofrecer.
texts.en:
Rosa, 53, works as a trader of various products and necessities. She is single and lives alone, so is fully committed to her business. She sells women's clothing, creams, perfumes, makeup and other beauty products, which she sells out of her home and on rounds with neighbors, friends and referrals.

Rosa is a very hardworking person who strives to earn her daily bread and all the essentials for her home. She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, with the intention of having the money to buy different types of clothes like blouses, skirts, pants and so on, also to invest in the purchase of bags, wallets, and cosmetics. With this Rosa will meet all the orders that have been placed and at the same time, she will have new products to offer.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, makeup and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed to make gowns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials needed for catering services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food supplements to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making snacks like puto and suman

loans.name: Dorkas

texts.en:
Dorkas, who is married and has 3 children, has a business selling gasoline. With 2 school-age children, Arfin, age 8 and Reyke, age 7, as well as Olivia, 2 at home, the income from the business was not sufficient to provide for the daily needs of the family.

To improve the situation, Dorkas established a second business as a kiosk operator which has improved her daily income. Although the kiosk business has been operating successfully for 6 years, most of the profit is used to cover her children’s school fees. So Dorkas wants to improve the prospects of her business by adding more stock. To enable her purchase more products such as instant noodles, cigarettes, snacks, candy, cold drinks, soap and pens, Dorkas is applying for a 3,000,000 IDR loan from TLM. She is convinced that with this loan and an improved range of products, the business income will increase to provide a stable income to cover increasing family expenditures.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as instant noodles, cigarettes, snacks, candy, cold drinks, soap and pens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofia es muy honesta, trabajadora y responsable, vive junto a su esposo, un hijo y su madre de edad muy avanzada quien ha pesar de esto le ayuda con algunas actividades del hogar incluso con el negocio.  Sofía posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y de uso para el hogar, este negocio lo posee desde hace cinco años y ha sido muy positivo para la económica de su hogar, por lo que desea mejorarlo en lo que sea posible y así contar con mayores ganancias, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar: sopas instantáneas, pasta dental, golosinas, jugos, sodas, pan y otros más los cuales son muy importantes para el sostenimiento de una tienda y así mismo para contar con varios clientes, lo cual es muy positivo para su economía.
texts.en: Sofia is very honest, hard-working, and responsible.  She lives with her husband, son, and her mother who is very elderly and has, in spite of this, helped with some household activities including the business.  Sofia has a shop of basic staples and household items.  She has had this business for  five years and is has been very positive for her household finances, which she wants to improve as much as possible and thus have higher profits.  This is the reason she asked INTEGRAL for a loan with which she will have the money needed to buy: instant soup, toothpaste, candies, juices, sodas, bread, and other items that are very important for maintaining the shop and also for having multiple customers, which is very helpful for her finances.

loans.use: to buy candies, juices, and other things.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 53-year-old, married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She sells puto (rice cake) to a nearby school as a source of income. She has been in the food vending business for 10 years. Maria earns 7,000 pesos a month by doing the food vending. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar and cooking oil. In the future, Maria would like to invest in other business ventures to support her family as well as to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su pequeña familia; él se dedica a la producción de zapatos para dama y caballero, y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en la elaboración y venta lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, ya tiene mucha clientela y las personas lo prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden del cliente; Víctor es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, y todo un soñador, todos los días lucha por cumplir cada una de sus metas y se esforzara al máximo hasta lograr ese éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y como todo buen comerciante desea aprovechar para acrecentar el negocio, pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cuero, pegamento, cintas, etc. Víctor Manuel tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, esta muy contenta con la ayuda y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel, 41, lives together with his small family. He makes and sells shoes for men and women and has gained a lot of experience, which has resulted in better profits. He has manifold customers. They prefer his products because of their quality and affordable prices and because his service has no equal; he always listens to the customers’ needs.

Víctor is an enterprising man, committed to his work. He is a dreamer, striving every day in order to meet all his goals and he will not stop until he succeeds. During the last few weeks, the demand has increased and as the good salesman he is, he wants to take advantage of this situation in order to expand his business. For this, he needs some capital, so he is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to buy leather, glue, laces, etc.

Víctor Manuel has good references and is very responsible. He appreciates the help given and he is sure that he will be able to pay back in time and that he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy leather, glue and laces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear cloths to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance for the flower garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials needed in manicures and pedicures

loans.name: Elsa Cristina

texts.es: Elsa de 35 años de edad, es muy responsable, honrada y trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo, tres hijos y su padre. Elsa trabaja muy duro comercializando ropa, calzado y cosméticos que ofrece de forma ambulante por diferentes zonas del país, Elsa trabaja largas horas ya que trata de abarcar mayor cantidad de lugares para vender más. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cosméticos como: sombras, labiales, perfumes y otros, así mismo para invertir en la compra de ropa para mujeres, hombres y niños. El mayor deseo de Elsa es poder mejorar sus ganancias y de esta manera contar con todo lo necesario en su hogar.
texts.en:
Elsa, 35, is a responsible, honest and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, three children and with her father. Elsa works hard; she sells clothes, shoes and cosmetics, travelling to different regions of the country. Elsa works extra hours in order to visit more places and sell more.

She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to be able to buy a larger quantity of cosmetics like eye shadow, lipsticks and perfumes, as wells as clothes for women, men and children.

Her biggest wish is to be able to improve her profits and in this way to have everything that her family requires.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and clothes.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida; Él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente a la crianza y venta de pollos  tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro  y ha ganado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias el negocio  esta en su vivienda muy accesible para trabajar, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque siempre posee lo que necesitan, con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Pablo es un hombre dedicado a su labor, enérgico y luchador, todos los días se levanta dispuesto a lograr sus objetivos, se esfuerza al máximo pues sabe que así alcanzara el éxito que desea, en la ultima temporada no pudo obtener las ganancias esperadas por eso quiere recuperarse y realizar una nueva inversión para ello le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pollos, concentrado etc. Pablo tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda esta contento con la ayuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pablo is 37 years old and lives with his life partner. He works in agriculture, specifically raising and selling chickens. He has worked in the industry for several years and has gained much experience which allows him to get the best income. The business is in his home, and thus very accessible.

He trades all around the community and already has many customers who prefer him because he always has what they need, with quality products at affordable prices and above all excellent service. Pablo is a man dedicated to his work, an energetic fighter who gets up every day ready to achieve his goals; he tries his best knowing that this is how he will achieve the success he desires. 

Last season he could not achieve the expected earnings, so he wants to recover and make a new investment. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy chickens, feed, etc. Pablo has good payment references and ensures that he can repay the debt. He is happy to have the help and at the same time he has faith that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is now 57 years old and has three grown-up children. She is separated from her husband due to family conflicts and misunderstandings. Despite this, she has the determination to improve their status of living and give her children a better life. 

She owns and manages a computer shop and Xerox machine near the capitol site. She has been operating the business for almost 12 years and usually earns profits of P10,000 (Philippines pesos) a month that she utilizes for their daily consumption and saves for their future. 

She aims to improve her computer shop by acquiring an additional set of computers, typewriters for rent and Xerox machines to provide service, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional P50,000 to buy said computers, typewriters and Xerox machines. She mentioned that this loan will be a great help for her to improve business, and she is hoping that someday, she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy an additional set of computers, Xerox machines and typewriters for rent.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio's business focus mainly on the agricultural sector, particularly on farming and livestock. He began operating his livestock business when he was 20 years of age. At very young age, he devoted his time to raising hogs and crops due to lack of finances. Gregorio is really thankful to God because, although he didn't enter college, he is still able to manage his agricultural business well.

Gregorio is a responsible spouse and industrious father to his five children. The couple aim for one goal, to have a stable source of income. This goal pushes the couple to strive hard to obtain their dreams in life. Gregorio's livestock business is growing, so he is also in need of bigger capital. With his situation, he is seeking for financial support amounting to PHP 25,000 allowing him to sustain the livestock needs of raising his hogs. Gregorio knows that it would help him to improve his livestock and farming businesses.

loans.use: to buy stock feed for raising his hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es: Celsa de 60 años de edad, vive junto a dos hijos quienes se dedican a trabajar y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar. Celsa posee una tienda de productos perecederos como: golosinas, sodas, pan, lácteos y otros más y para percibir mayores ganancias elabora tortillas de lunes a domingo, contando con varios clientes fijos, fue gracias a estos negocios como ella pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, por lo que en la actualidad son muy importantes para ella ya que le permiten contar con su sustento diario y así mismo contar con todo lo necesario para ella. Celsa solicita un préstamo con el cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para elaborar las tortillas, así mismo para comprar gas propano y productos para surtir la tienda y así aumentar sus ganancias brindándoles a los clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
60-year-old Celsa lives with two children who work to make a living and help her with the household expenses.  Celsa has a store for perishable products like candies, sodas, bread, and dairy products, among others; and in order to get higher earnings she makes tortillas from Monday through Sunday.  She has many loyal customers.  It was thanks to these businesses that she was able to get her children ahead in life, and which today are very important to her because they allow her to count on daily sustenance and likewise count on everything she needs.  

Celsa asks for a loan with which she can buy a larger quantity of corn to make her tortillas, and also to buy propane gas and products to stock up her store and thus increase her profits by offering her customers better service.

loans.use: to buy corn and basic products to stock up her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa est né vers 1977 à Bougouni. Père de 4 enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Il mène des activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis plus de 15 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs et du sorgho. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son  9 eme prêt maintenant, les huit prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  5 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de sorgho.
Il s’approvisionne dans les villages de Garalo et environs. Les céréales sont stockées dans son magasin pendant un certain temps. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de Sikasso et de Bamako et souvent Drissa les transporte à Bamako au besoin. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Drissa was born in Bougouni in around 1977. He is the father of four children and lives in a traditional family in the neighbourhood of Massablacoura in Bougouni (which is in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
 
Drissa has been trading cereals for more than 15 years. His experience in the area has given him a good reputation, and he receives orders for cereals, mainly maize and sorghum. 

In order to gain the resources necessary to satisfy his customers, he is collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is his ninth loan, and the previous eight have all been repaid in full. 

This loan will enable him to buy 5 tonnes of maize and 1 tonne of sorghum. He buys his supplies in the villages in Garalo and the surrounding area. The cereals are stored in his shop before being resold for cash to men and women from Sikasso and Bamako. Often, he transports the cereals to Bamako if required. 

With this loan, Drissa envisages earning an average of 150 000 CFA francs per month. The money remaining after loan repayments will go towards investing in his business. He is intending to become a wholesaler in Bougouni.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a hardworking mother who owns and manages a variety store in the community. She is 56 years old and has five grown-up children. Through hard work and perseverance, she and her husband were able to support the education of their children. At present, all of them are already employed and have their own families. Despite this, Francisca and her husband aimed to improve and continue the business to generate a sufficient income for their daily living and to save some for future emergencies. She aimed to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands, but not having enough capital, Francisca is requesting for an additional 25,000 PHP to buy rice, feeds, soft drinks, frozen foods, canned goods, snack foods, beverages and seasonings for sale. She believes that someday, she will improve the business and their status of living through their patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy rice, feeds, soft drinks, frozen foods, canned goods, snack foods, beverages and seasonings for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moustapha est un homme marié de 58 ans et père de 4 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille polygame à Bougouni.
Après l’école coranique, il tenta plusieurs activités mais sans succès. C’est ainsi qu’après mure réflexion, il décide d’apprendre auprès de son oncle les activités d’achat et de vente de boeufs. Après avoir eu un petit fonds de commerce à travers un frère, il décide de s’installer à son propre compte dans la même activité que beaucoup des membres de son ethnie.à savoir l’achat vente d’animaux notamment de boeufs.
Avec une expériences de plus de 15 ans, il maîtrise son activité dans laquelle il est très sollicité et apprécié.
Après avoir correctement remboursé les sept précédents prêt il est à son huitième prêt qui sera utilisé pour  acheter  10 boeufs.  Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et environs. La vente se fait au marché à bétail de Bougouni. Ses clients sont composés surtout des bouchers et des commerçants en provenance de Bamako. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qui servira en subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Moustapha is 58 years old, married and the father of four. He lives with his wife and children in a polygamous family in Bougouni.

After attending Koranic School, he tried several business ideas, but without success. After serious reflection, he decided to learn the cattle trade from his uncle. Thanks to modest business funds from a brother, he was able to set up his own business in the same area as many others of his own ethnicity - buying and selling animals, mainly cattle.

With more than 15 years experience, he knows the business well and is much appreciated and sought-after.

He has fully repaid seven previous loans and this is his eighth. It will be used to buy 10 head of cattle. Moustapha buys stock in Bougouni and the surrounding area. He sells his stock at the cattle market in Bougouni. His clients are mainly butchers and traders from Bamako. 

With this loan, Moustapha is hoping to make 150 000 CFA francs per month, which will help him meet family expenses and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coconut shells for making charcoal.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo is a married man and a father of four children from Nocnocan,Talibon, Bohol. He has run a sari-sari (variety) store in his place, selling various goods for several years now. Maximo works hard to support the needs of the family.

Maximo is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in his store, such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, snack food, soap and other items.

In the future, Maximo wants to expand his business and experience the fullness of life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in his store such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, snack food, soap and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is a mother who has a strong faith and is determined to become successful in the future. She is 49 years old and widowed. Despite this hardship, she aims to improve her variety store and her hog-raising business to generate sufficient income and support the education of her three children. Two of her children are far enough along in school to need more financial support for their school fees and allowances. For this reason, Lalaine hopes to improve and strengthen her business. By generating a higher income to support the education of her children she hopes to enable them to earn degrees and become professionals someday. 

To improve the business, Lalaine is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, biscuits, candies, laundry soaps, beverages, and seasonings to sell. She believes that her patience and strong determination will allow her to achieve her dreams in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of food and household items to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 60 años de edad vive junto a su esposo con quien trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Ella trabaja desde su hogar ya que posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, contando con varios clientes fijos. Debido a falta de fondos Carmen no ha podido surtir más su negocio, lo cual es muy importante para mejorar sus ganancias y su estabilidad ya que así contará con más clientes. Carmen solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL por medio del cual pueda comprar todos los productos necesarios como: jabón, detergentes, bebidas, granos básicos y otros más con lo que pueda garantizar el sostenimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen, 60, lives together with her husband. They both work hard to get ahead in life. She works from home. She has a store where she sells perishable and essential goods. She has a few loyal customers.

Because she has lacked the money, Carmen has not been able to restock her business, which is very important in order to improve her profits and stability, because it will attract more clients.

Carmen is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL with which she will be able to buy the products she needs: soap, detergent, beverages, basic grains among other. This will guarantee the continuation of her business.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent and beverages, among other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.en:
Sohiba is an entrepreneur who is married with 2 children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 3 years. Little by little, with the passing of time, she has perfected her knowledge. She sells her animals in the local market. Thanks to their good condition, she has managed to win a large number of customers for her business. Many of her customers are local butchers who are glad for her work.
 
Sohiba is looking for a loan to buy young cattle so she can offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She is asking for a loan of 2000 USD to buy young cattle for developing her business further. Each month she will make her payments on time. Sohiba awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to raise and resell

loans.name: Rufo

texts.en: Rufo is a 40-year-old married man from Antequera, Bohol. He has no children yet. He is engaged in a motorcycle transport business. He transports his customers to remote areas in their community. He also operates a sari-sari (variety) store, which his wife manages while he operates the motorcycle transport business. Rufo has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy new tires for his motorcycle and more merchandise to sell, such as soft drinks, canned goods, and noodles. In the future, Rufo would like expand his business to support his family.

loans.use: to buy tires for his motorcycle and stocks of additional merchandise for his variety store

loans.name: Mariane

texts.fr:
Marianne, âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et a 8 enfants dont le plus âgé a 21 ans et le moins âgé a 6 ans. Tous ses enfants vont à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge. Elle est née en République Démocratique du Congo et a 6 ans de l’éducation primaire.
Pour le crédit contracté, elle va augmenter la quantité des petits poissons qu’elle va et va assurer les frais accessoires d’achat comme le transport, la communication, etc.
Le vol, l’accident ou la décision gouvernementale concernant la protection douanière sont les seules difficultés de non remboursement qu’entend Marianne. L’accueil chaleureux des clients, la sensibilisation en faveur de son commerce et l’expansion de son marché jusqu’en RDC sont les stratégies qu’utilisera Marianne pour la croissance de son commerce.
Elle a l’ambition de devenir une grande commerçante des produits alimentaires. Pour sa famille, elle va continuer d’assurer le bien être de sa famille, améliorer leur maison et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mariane is 39 years old, married and the mother of eight children. The eldest is 21 and the youngest six. All her children are in school, and she has no one else to look after. She was born in the Democratic Republic of the Congo and completed six years of primary school.

Mariane will use her loan to increase the quantity of small fish she sells and pay for additional expenses such as transport, communications, etc.

As far as Mariane can see, the only problems that would present repayment difficulties are theft, accident or a government decision concerning customs protection. 

Mariane's strategies for business growth are: providing a warm welcome for customers, promoting her business and expanding her market into the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

Her aim is to become a large-scale food trader. She will continue to ensure the well-being of her family, improve their home and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of small fish she sells.

loans.name: Lucia Del Rosario

texts.es: Lucia de 22 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad, así mismo vive junto a su madre, su padrastro y hermanos en la misma casa. Lucia se dedica a la elaboración de tamales de elote, los cuales vende de lunes a viernes por diferentes zonas comerciales, brindándole ganancias aceptables que son fundamentales para el sostenimiento del hogar, su madre le ayuda con el negocio dividiéndose las zonas en que los venden. Lucia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de elotes, así mismo para comprar una cocina industrial y hoyas para hacer más tamales. Ella es una madre responsable y una esposa que desea brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su compañero de vida para contar con una mejor vida.
texts.en:
22-year-old Lucia lives with her husband and two young children while also living with her mother, stepfather, and siblings in the same house.  Lucia makes a living making corn tamales that she sells from Monday to Friday throughout different commercial areas, which offers acceptable earnings that are fundamental to sustaining the home.  Her mother helps with the business by splitting up the areas in which they sell.  

Lucia asks for a loan from INTEGRAL through which she can buy a larger quantity of corn, and also buy an industrial stove and basin for making more tamales.  She is a responsible mother and wife who desires to provide all the help that is needed to her life partner in order to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn for making and selling tamales.

loans.name: Santiago De Jesus

texts.es: Santiago de 56 años  es un señor muy emprendedor quien se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería de forma ambulante y en puntos estratégicos donde las personas lo conocen y muchas de ellas con clientes frecuentes.  Él vive junto a su esposa y tres nietos menores de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Desde hace nueve años que Santiago trabaja de esta manera, lo cual le ha permitido contar con lo más básico en su hogar. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de billetes de lotería y así poder vender más y aprovechar al máximo a sus clientes quienes en algunas ocasiones le compran más de un billete a lo que Santiago debe sacarle provecho.
texts.en:
Santiago, 56, is an enterprising man that sells lottery tickets in the streets. He sells in strategic places where people know him. A lot of them are frequent customers.

He lives together with his wife and three underage grandchildren that go to school. Nine years ago, Santiago started with this line of work, which has helped him to make a living.

He is now requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, so that he can buy a larger quantity of lottery tickets. He will then be able to sell more. In addition, sometimes some of his clients want to buy more than one ticket, so he has to make the most out of this situation.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets and sell them.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina, tiene 42 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Anteriormente Evangelina se dedicaba a la venta de verduras en el mercado municipal. Ahora en su casa tiene establecido el negocio de cría, engorde y venta de pollos. Hace un año que comenzó y ya tiene su clientela. Este pollo lo cría, luego lo destaza y lo vende en piezas o entero en su comunidad. Ella quiere incrementar la cantidad de pollos para incrementar las ventas y los ingresos. Por eso ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 20,000 Lempiras para comprar 300 pollos más y el alimento (concentrado). Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio e incrementar los ingresos para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Evangelina, 42, is married and has 3 children.  She lives in the town of Tela, in the department of Atlántida.  Evangelina has a business selling vegetables in the municipal market.
