His goal is to purchase a cow and keep it in the best possible condition, using specialized products for avoiding disease, parasite and other threats to the animal's health in order to sell it later on and gain some income for his humble family, which is dependent upon this enterprise. Since he is a poor man, he lacks the resources needed for making this purchase on his own. That is how he asked FUDECOSUR for a loan. In the past, he hasn't received any loans from public banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him a more accesible loan with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase and raise cattle

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a thirty two year old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for two years and works twelve hours a day. With the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children and restock her business. Inadequate capital is her major challenge while her desire is to educate children and expand her business to new markets. Juliet is requesting a loan to buy toys and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy  toys and clothes to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 38 years old. He lives in Baghdati district, West Georgia with his 37-year-old wife and 2 children (8 and 7 years old). The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a hectare of land where maize and nut-trees are grown. They also have a bakery and bake traditional Georgian bread. Besides, David has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese, nuts, maize and bread in their village at a good price. David is very hard working and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan to purchase wood and flour for baking bread. After supplying additional stock of flour and wood, they will be able to bake and sell more bread. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. David awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase wood and flour for baking bread

loans.name: Gathoni

texts.en:
Gathoni is a sixty-four-year-old farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where she lives with her husband. All her children have finished schooling. She has been in farming for the past twenty years producing milk, maize, and horticultural crops which she sells to the people around her local area.

She is requesting for 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will help her get more income which in turn will help her change her standards of living. She hopes to adopt modern dairy farming techniques in the next five years.

High costs of production and animal feeds are her major challenges in farming.

Gathoni is very greatful to Juhudi Kilimo for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en: Asaad is a 43-year-old married man and a father of 3 children. He owns a grocery store, which has been the only source of income for the family since 1997. He is well-known for his good morals and nice treatment of customers. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy special-offer products, in order to keep on pleasing his customers. Asaad has been an Al Majmoua borrower for 18 consecutive cycles, which have had a clear effect on his business development. Through this loan, Assad will be able to increase his profits by adding new products. He is always looking forward to expanding his store more and more.

loans.use: to buy special-offer products

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Fatmata from Torkpoi town Bo, Southern area. She is a married mother with 1 child aged 21 years, who is currently attending school. She began this business because she needed to raise income for the growth of her family.

To earn a living, Fatmata operates a food stand business within her neighborhood. She sells palm oil, rice, and pepper. She has been operating this business for the past 15 years. She works at the business 9 hours per day and 7 days per week. 

She is seeking her first loan, in the amount of Le 800000, so that she can purchase more food like palm oil, rice, and pepper for resale. The anticipated profit she expects to generate from the loan will be used to pay school fees for her child. Her dream is to improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she plans to own a residential plot of land. 

Fatmata thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more food like palm oil, rice, and pepper for resale.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.es:
Floriana de 41 años, es una madre muy abnegada y responsable, tiene a su pequeño retoño Marco de 5 añitos en quien invierte todo su amor y trabajo, su pareja Filomeno es su apoyo incondicional de toda la vida. Juntos habitan en una casa hecha de madera cuyos planes a futuro es construirla a base de material noble. Debido a un mal momento económico que vivía  decidió cambiar de rubro. Ingresando a la selva central y aprovechando las parcelas que le dejó sus padres, logró cultivar café y que con ayuda de sus esposo, pudo consolidar su trabajo. Una de las cosas que le agradan con respecto a su actividad es notar que sus parcelas cada vez son mas productivas, pues los granos de café son bien cotizados por los acopiadores a quien ella destina sus productos. No obstante los factores en contra al que tiene que afrontar son el tema del transporte debido a que debe contar con estibadores en un gran número para trasladar los granos secos al borde de la carretera para su posterior traslado a la ciudad.
Durante la época donde se inicia la época de mantenimiento tiene planeado brindar toda la atención del caso a sus plantaciones de café de manera que planea contratar a jornaleros para el sembrado y abono correspondiente de las plantas, adicional a ello desea remover una parte de su terreno para reforzar la productividad.
A futuro planea comprar un terreno adicional para ampliar la producción y por consiguiente las ganancias.
Este es su octavo crédito para el cual siempre mostró una buena conducta crediticia con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, manifiesta estar muy contenta con su grupo ya que siempre fueron claros y muy puntuales en sus pagos.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado para la contrata de jornaleros y la compra de sacos de abono orgánico para plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Floriana, 41, is a dedicated and responsible mother. She devotes all her love and effort to her 5 year old son, Marco. Her partner, Filomeno, has been her unconditional, life-long support. They live in a wooden house where they plan to lay concrete in the future. Because of a bad moment she went through once, she decided to seek for a economic activity. She moved to the jungle and, using a lot inherited from her parents, she was able to grow coffee and consolidate her business with her husband's support. One of her favorite things about her activity is to see how her lots become increasingly productive and how the coffee beans are well paid by the buyers in bulk to which she sells her products. However, she faces obstacles regarding transportation and needs to hire a large amount of carriers to help her take the dried beans to the side of the road for its subsequent transportation to the city.
During the growing season, she plans to cater to her coffee plantations in every possible way, hiring day laborers for planting and fertilizing coffee. She also wants to till part of her lot in order to reinforce productivity. 
Her plans for the future are to buy another plot to increase production and also profits. 
This will be Floriana's eighth loan. She has always been very punctual with her payments and is very satisfied with he group because they have always been clear and payed on time.
With the 1,000 new Soles requested, Floriana will complete the money she needs to hire day laborers and will purchase organic fertilizer for her coffee plantations.

loans.use: To hire day laborers and buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 30 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom are currently in school. For the past 4 years, Allen has been working hard to manage her clothes store and a tailoring business, which makes and sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and expand her business, and will help Allen to generate greater profits. Allen hopes that in the future she will be able to be more productive. 

Allen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Allen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and expand her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been selling second-hand clothes for the past 4 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET, LTD. after repaying the previous loan successfully. She used the previous loan to buy more stock of clothes to add to her business. Mary will use this loan to add more stock of second-hand clothes to sell in the coming high season.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop, which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes to add to her business.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en: Victoire is 25 years old. She is married and has one child aged 1. She sells used shoes and has requested a loan to buy more used shoes for sale. She plans to use the profits for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 67-year-old farmer in Kitale where she lives with her husband since all her children have finished schooling. Her children are between the ages of 50 to 30 years old. 

Esther has been farming for over 20 years producing poultry products, milk, maize, and horticultural crops, which she sells locally. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. After selling these products, she will earn more income, which  will help her uplift her standards of living. She aspires to specialize in poultry and dairy farming to serve a wider market in the next 5 years.

Unreliable rain and fluctuation of market prices are her major challenges in farming.

Esther is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for offering her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Olga Vanessa

texts.es:
Olga es originaria de Estelí, soltera, madre de dos hijos, de oficio comerciante. Ella inicio su negocio vendiendo en un kiosco de  gaseosa, además de  vender eso, también vendía refresco, enchilada y luego con los ahorros que recogió decidió poner su pulpería  para obtener  mayores ganancias.
Olga solicita  el crédito para invertir más en el negocio y poder comprar más  producto como gaseosa, jugo, carnes, pan y repostería, de esta manera hacer crecer el negocio
Su sueño es  poder  llegar a tener un comedor   y una pulpería más grande  de esta manera poder ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is originally from Estelí. She is single, the mother of two children, and works as a shopkeeper. She began her business selling soft drinks in a kiosk. In addition to this, she also sold refreshments and enchiladas, and then, with the savings that she collected, she decided to set up her grocery store to obtain greater earnings.

Olga is applying for the loan to invest more in her business and be able to buy more products such as soft drinks, juice, meats, bread, and pastries. In this way she will make her business grow. 

Her goal is to be able to have a dining area and a bigger grocery store, and in this way she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juice, meats, bread, and pastries to sell.

loans.name: Paulina Santusa

texts.es: La Sra. Paulina  tiene 40 años y casado  con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  12 y 6 años, ella se dedica a  servicio costura de enaguas para las cholitas son como faldas delgadas que las mujeres usan debajo su pollera , en su taller propio que se encuentran en zona Santiago Segundo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Paulina  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de variedad de telas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es quiere mejorar la calidad del trabajo realizado ya que tiene pedidos que entregar a distintos mercados ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, la Sra. Paulina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de maquinas de coser y a veces de material cuando le hacen pedidos por mayor depende de los trabajos que tiene que realizar y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de maquinas, La Sra. Paulina es una persona trabajadora que su deseo es tener un taller grande y contratar mano de obra y así enseñar a jóvenes el oficio de la confección.
texts.en: Señora Paulins is 40 years old. She is married and has two sons, ages 12 and 6. Her work is sewing petticoats for the indigenous women. They are like thin skirts that the women use underneath their skirts. She has her own workshop in the Santiago Segundo zone. This is her first loan with this institution. Señora Paulina is going to use the loan to buy a variety of fabrics. Her reason for applying for this loan is that she wants to improve the quality of the work she does, since she has orders to deliver to different markets, since at this time of year there is much demand. Señora Pauling faces challenges in her business, which are the lack of sewing machines and at times of material, when they give her wholesale orders, depending on the work that she has to do. She is going to use her earnings to buy machines. Señora Paulina is a hard-working person whose desire is to have a big workshop and contract hand work and thus teach young people the trade of making clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make petticoats.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 41-year-old enterprising business lady who is married to her husband, Thomas. They both distribute timber and this has been their business for the past 3 years. They earn a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.

Monica is applying for her fifth loan term from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans. She used the previous loan to buy a power saw for cutting down timber. Monica will use this loan to buy more trees for timber.

With the anticipated profits from the business, she will buy another power saw.  Her hopes and dreams are to expand her timber business, to buy a piece of land, and to build rental houses to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more trees for timber.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 36-year-old single Lebanese woman living with her parents and only one working sibling. 

In 2004, Nisrine started running her own shop selling accessories and souvenirs. She has a wide variety of home accessories, perfumes, and many other items. Her income is really essential to help her father with the family’s household expenses. Her story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges that the Lebanese woman faces in running a business while at the same supporting her family. This is the reason of why she is asking today for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand her store’s inventory of perfumes, accessories, and souvenirs. Her intention is to augment her sales and amplify her income as well. She dreams of having her own family and children.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory of perfumes, accessories, and souvenirs.

loans.name: Sara Leyda

texts.es:
Sara  tiene  42 años es originaria de Estelí, de oficio comerciante, casada, madre de dos hijos, los cuales estudian la primaria. Ella inicio su negocio a la edad de 33 años fue, vendiendo caramelos y snacks así fue incrementando sus ventas, su esposo la ha apoyado desde el principio. Actualmente se dedica a vender   sus productos  en su casa, pero  a ella le gustaría ampliar más su negocio en la misma ciudad.
 Solicita el préstamo para poder invertir más en su negocio y asi poder comprar más  granos básicos  como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, etc. de esta manera  poder ofrecer mas productos a mis clientes y poder satisfacer sus necesidades y asi obtener un nuevo ingresos para poder comprar una refrigeradora y  poder ampliar su pulpería con venta de productos lácteos, jugos y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Sara is 42 years old. She is originally from Estelí. She is a shopkeeper, is married, and is the mother of two children, who are in primary school. She began her business at the age of 33, selling candies and snacks, and then increasing her sales. Her husband has supported her from the beginning. Now she sells her products in her home, but she would like to expand her business in the same city.

She is applying for the loan so that she can invest more in her business by being able to buy more basic foodstuffs such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, etc. In this way she will be able to offer more products to her customers and satisfy their needs and thus obtain new income so that she can buy a refrigerator and expand her business with the sale of dairy products, juices, and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, etc, for her store

loans.name: Kayirsa

texts.ru: Кайырса со своей семьей живет в одном из высокогорных сел Кыргызстана – селе Эмгекчил,что что на севере страны. Ей 43 года, воспитывает 5 детей. Кайырса в качестве источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS)в 1989 году на сегодняшний день хозяйство насчитывает  2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 10 голов овец, 1 лошадь, и приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кайырса обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 быков на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы Кайырса планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства и на образование детей. В своей жизни для нее самыми важными являются дети. Вырастить детей и дать им образование это цель ради которой она работает.
texts.en: Kayirsa and her family live in Emgekchil, one of the mountain villages of Kyrgystan, in the north of the country. She is 43 years old and bringing up five children. Kayirsa raises livestock, which is the main source of income for her family.  Her farm, launched in 1989 with the initial capital of 15,000 KGS, now includes two dairy cows with their young, 10 sheep, one horse; sales of milk and dairy products bring in   about 5,000 KGS per month. In order to develop her business further, Kayirsa has turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy bulls for fattening and resale. Kayirsa plans to use her revenues to expand her farm and  provide for her children’s education. Her children are the most important thing in her life. She works for the sake of bringing up and educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase bulls and sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers (70 kg) and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of food stuffs like sugar, rice, cooking oil, and sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Cam

texts.en:
Cam is 32 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda, in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Cam has been working hard to manage his retail store, which sells posho, sugar and drinks. 

To help expand his business, Cam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stocks of sugar, maize flour, and soft drinks to sell in his store, allowing him to generate greater profits and have everything he needs for sale. Cam hopes that in the future he will be able to grow the business. 

Cam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Cam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize flour, and soft drinks to sell in his store.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo runs a sari-sari, or variety store, in his own place in San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the business for more than 10 years now, selling various goods like bread, biscuits, noodles, and canned goods.

Romeo is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell in his store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, soap, and shampoo.
In the future, Romeo hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in his store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Aminata from Torkpoi town, Bo, in Sierra Leone's Southern Province. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 10 and 20. Both are going to school.

Aminata runs a food business at her house. She has been running this business for the past 11 years. She works at the business every day, starting at 4 a.m., and she does not rest until she comes back from the market to prepare food for the next day. Her business is her only source of income. She says cooking is the best business for her because she can feed herself and her family.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to expand her shop by buying bags of rice, cooking oil and seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and improve her living conditions. In the future, she plans to send her children to university. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to expand her cookery shop by buying bag rice, cooking oil and cooking season

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Alice has been working hard to manage her fast food business, which sells fast food like chips. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase Irish potatoes, fish, and other things needed for the business, and it will help Alice to generate greater profits and cater for her family. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to be a powerful business lady. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes, fish and other things needed for the business

loans.name: Mounir

texts.en:
Mounir is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children.

In 1990, Mounir started his own business as a fisherman. It was a hobby that turned into a profession, which can return on him with higher revenue. In parallel, he works as a farmer; his job consists of cultivating vegetables. He takes good care of the land and always seeks to diversify the harvests to be able to satisfy his clients' needs.

Today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new, bigger fishing nets. He states that the loan will help him increase his business productivity by a fair percentage, which will certainly enhance his way of living. In the future, he plans to open his own fishery.

loans.use: to purchase new, bigger fishing nets.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro is a 28 year old married man from Bien Unido, Bohol, and the father of a 1 year old child. He is engaged in seaweed farming, and also fishes as a source of income. He sells his fish and seaweed, and earns 5,400 pesos a month from the two businesses. He has requested a loan of 5,000 pesos to purchase additional seaweed, fishing nets and wood. In the future, Alejandro would like to expand his business activities by investing in other ventures to support his family and maintain a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy  seaweed, wood, fishing nets, and wood

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 32 years old. He sells clothes and has been selling clothes for one year. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget is a 30-year-old married woman with two children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a teacher for four years and also farms for another source of income. Like most farmers, she is challenged by unpredictable weather changes. Also, she receives low pay as a teacher. Her dream is to have a good house and venture into modern farming methods. She also wants to educate her children up to the university. Bridget is requesting for a loan to pay workers to renovate her house and buy the necessary materials.

loans.use: to pay workers to renovate her house and buy the necessary materials.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is 31 years old. He has been a businessman for the past five years, selling shoes. He wants the loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more pairs of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 41 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. For the past five years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, maize flour and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more retail stock such as sugar and soap, and will help Robert generate greater profits and increase his stock for more profits. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his business sales. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more retail stock, such as sugar and soap.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a seaweed farming business together for more than 20 years now.
Leonila is asking for a loan to buy seaweed farming materials such as straw, seaweed seedlings and rope.
Through this, she will be able to augment their seaweed production.
In the future, Leonila dreams of expanding their livelihood and exploring another venture to augment their income.

loans.use: to buy seaweed farming materials such as straw, seaweed seedlings and rope.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Mario Ernesto de treinta y cinco de edad  vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia; El se dedica a realizar trabajos en metal y lamina, fabrica defensas para ventanas, puertas, portones, enrejado entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, esta ubicado en su vivienda y es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad por lo que ya tiene clientela fija que lo prefiere por los buenos precios, la calidad y el servicio excelente; Mario es un hombre dedicado a su labor y a toda su familia son las dos cosas mas importantes en su vida, se esfuerza todos los días por ofrecerles un futuro mejor y una vida digna, esta pendiente de todo lo que necesitan, en los últimos meses la casa ha tenido deterioros y necesita reparaciones para seguridad y comodidad de los que la habitan, pero Mario no cuenta con el suficiente capital que la respalde por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tejas, cemento, piso, herramientas etc., Mario Ernesto tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene la esperanza que le ofrecerá a su familia una vida plena como se la merecen.
texts.en:
Mario Ernesto is 35 years old and lives with his life partner in a house they own. He works with metal and sheets, manufactures protection for windows, doors, gates, and railings, among others. He has been in the business for several years and has a lot of experience with sales. He is located in his home and is well known for the local people, thus he has regular clients who prefer him for the good prices, quality and excellent service. 

Mario is a man dedicated to his job and to his family; they are the two most important things in his life. He strives every day in order to offer them a better future and a dignified life. He is always aware of what they need. 

In the last months, the house has had some damage that needs to be fixed for safety and comfort of those who live in it. However, Mario doesn't have enough capital to support it, so he decided to apply for a loan to INTEGRAL to buy tiles, cement, floors, tools, etc. 

Mario Ernesto has good payment references and is very responsible. He ensures que will repay the debt in the time established. At the same time, he also hopes to offer to his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement, floor, and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more packaging material

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a married Lebanese man. He’s 33 years old. He’s really attached to his wife and child. Cooperating together, Ali and his wife were able to cover their heavy life expenses in order to live a respectable life. Ali started his business at an early age. He had to work with professionalism to provide necessary support for his family. He started his own work in 2004. He owns a car mechanic shop where he also sells wheels in large quantities. In a short period, Ali has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services, and he is looking forward to increasing this number. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a large quantity of wheels in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ orders. He believes that acting properly will allow him to maintain good relations with his customers. In the future, he plans to expand his business and widen his target.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of wheels in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ orders

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 31 years old. She is married and has three children, all enrolled in school. She sells foodstuff and has been in the business for the past four years. With the loan, she wants to offer more tons of rice, beans, and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more tons of rice, beans, and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 49-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children. In 2005, in order to supplement the family’s income, he decided to start his own business as a farmer. His job consists of cultivating vegetables. He has his own land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables to satisfy the wide range of clients asking for his products. Mahmoud also benefits from his retirement compensation after being involved in the Lebanese army many years ago. Today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a pick-up and facilitate the way he transports his harvests. It’s a time issue as well; the pick-up will help Mahmoud transport his products in less time.  In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and expand his lands by cultivating a wider variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a pick-up and facilitate the way he transports his harvests

loans.name: Naftaly

texts.en:
Naftaly is 43 years old and married to Anastacia, and they are blessed with one child.

Naftaly owns a retail shop in Kajiando. He has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES 10,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET MFI of KES 100,000, which he plans to use to buy more stock like sugar, eggs, tea leaves, sweets, and many other items. He will use the extra profit to pay fees for his child. He hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, tea bags, and eggs

loans.name: Dewis Enrique

texts.es: Dewis compró una caja nueva, para mejorar su negocio de reparación de calzado y tambien compró inusmos como suelas, pegantes y tambien adquirió para su otro negocio, nuevos termos en los que vende el delicioso café colombiano. En la actualidad está palicando a un nuevo credikiva para comprar pegante, suelas, etc y ampliar un poco mas su negocio. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es de agradecimiento porque le dieron la oportunidad de tener un credito, pues nunca  habia tenido uno; el dice textualmente que "la verdad es que me sirvió de mucho."
texts.en:
Dewis bought a new shoeshine box to help improve his shoe repair business. He also bought supplies, such as soles and adhesives. Dewis also started another business by purchasing new thermoses for selling delicious Colombian coffee.

At the moment, he is applying for a new Kiva loan so that he can buy adhesives, soles, and other supplies in order to expand his business a little bit more. His message to Kiva lenders is one of appreciation because they have given him the opportunity to access credit, which he never had before. Dewis says, “The truth is that it has helped me a great deal.”

loans.use: to buy adhesives, soles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old. She is married and has six children. She own a grocery shop where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been in business for five years. She also earns an income from farming and through the support of Faulu Kenya she has grown tremendously.

She wishes to grow her business more. She requires a loan of 105,300 Kenyan shillings (KES) to increase her stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to increase her stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman is a 39-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to Dalal, a very kind woman. They have five children attending school. Salman is a great man who loves his family and really cares to offer them a respectable life. He works nonstop, on his own, to be able to cover their expenses. He has been working as a carpenter for more than ten years, and he decided to open his own carpentry business in 2010. He’s an honest man and above all punctual, which is what makes his customers loyal to him. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase supplies and materials for his business, such as paint, wood, and many other items. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him to start his new project properly. He’s doing his best to collect higher revenues and teach his children at high level schools to help them live a very comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and materials for his business, such as paint, wood, and many other items

loans.name: Lucio Neri

texts.es: El Sr.  Lucio tiene 31 años y es casado con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  2 y 8 años, el se dedica a la producción y venta de tinas para  baños, el vive por la zona de Bolonia al sur de la ciudad de la Paz, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Lucio va a utilizar este préstamo para compra de insumos y materiales  para la fabricación de sus tinas de baño  ya que tiene  pedido de tinas  que tiene que entregar y que por falta de capital no lo puede realizar, El Sr. Lucio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y la falta de materiales, El Sr. Lucio va a utilizar los beneficios en la fabricación de mas productos por mayor, El Sr. Lucio se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta la única actividad que tiene para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Lucio is 31 years old, married, and has two children (ages 2 and 8). He produces and sells bathtubs. Lucio lives in the District of Bolonia, which is south of the city of La Paz. This loan is his second with Emprender.

Sr. Lucio will use this loan to buy supplies and materials for making bathtubs. He already has orders for bathtubs to deliver, but he lacks the capital necessary to fulfill them. Sr. Lucio confronts challenges in his business, such as competition and the lack of materials. He will utilize these benefits so that he can manufacture more of his products in bulk.

Sr. Lucio is pleased and grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided since this is the only business activity by which he is able to support his family.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for making bathtubs.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a seventy-five-year-old farmer in Kitale County in Kenya, where she has been practicing farming for the past forty years. She is widowed, and all her thirteen children have finished school. She has several rental houses that provide her an additional source of income.

She is requesting a 50,000-KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry, from which she will get extra money to help sustain her and grandchildren's livelihood.

Expensive animal feed and diseases are major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 34-year-old Mariama from Kandeh town in the southern area. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 10 and 13. Both children attend school. 

Mariama runs a palm oil business. She sells palm oil. She has been running this business for the past 15 years. She works at the business every day, going door to door to sell her palm oil. She does not have any source of income except her business. She says that the main challenge to her business is that she needs a permanent business location.

Mariama has requested a loan in order to expand her palm oil business. The anticipated profit she expects to generate from the loan process will be used to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she plans to establish a big palm oil store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to expand her palm oil business

loans.name: Haydie

texts.en: Haydie is a 36-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with six children ages 9 to 20. She and her husband are engaged in fishing to support the needs of their children. She also catches crabs, which really helps in generating revenue for her family. She is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy crab traps, nylon, paint, and fish hooks. She is optimistic that it will help her to be in the right footing for her business. Her income will provide her family a healthy diet and school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to have another fishing boat for increased income.

loans.use: to buy crab traps, nylon, paint, and fish hooks

loans.name: Edgar Isaias

texts.es:
Edgar es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres a quienes quiere muchísimo en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y sobre todo por su gastronomía variada y muy rica. Día a día Edgar trabaja como albañil, el labora alrededor de 9horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar ya que ellos tienen pocos ingresos; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable con sus clientes y porque a pesar de lo duro de su trabajo lo hace con gusto y con muchas ganas de poder salir adelante.

Edgar está agradecido con el apoyo que le han podido brindar los prestatarios Kiva ya que con esta ayuda el podrá comprar madera para su trabajo, ya que actualmente tiene que alquilarlas, de esta manera el tendrá las herramientas necesarias para poder trabajar y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de construcción”.
texts.en:
Edgar is a 20 year old young man, he lives next to his parents whom he loves dearly, in the city of Chincha.  Chincha is a city known for its warm climate but overall because of its variety of delicious food. Edgar is a construction worker and works 9 hours a day, from the fruits of his labor he helps out his parents with household expenses since they have little income.  He believes his good fortune has come from the proper treatment he gives his customers and aside from the fact that it is hard labor, he does it willingly and with intent to get ahead.

Edgar is thankful for the support Kiva lenders have been able to offer him; with this help he will be able to purchase wood for his job.  He currently has to rent the wood he uses and with this purchase he would have the tools needed to continue working towards his dream of one day having his own construction company.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past 5 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her salon, which sells braids and extensions, and plaits hair. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair weaves, relaxers, and treatments, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and attract more customers. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to stock her salon with more products not there. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves, relaxers, and treatments

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is an aged 40 farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years, producing milk, horticultural crops and maize which she sells locally. She runs posho mills as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow, which will give her extra income to uplift her family's livelihood. She aspires to have expanded the size of her farm in the next five years.

The high cost of feeds and unreliable rainfall are her major challenges in farming.

She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for offering the support.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
This is Amani, a 27-year-old engaged woman, resident of Lebanon. She has an adorable family composed of her parents and two lovely siblings. They are all combining forces to carry on their life in a proper way despite all circumstances. At this time she decided to have her own business, hoping to take some responsibilities off of her father, their main income provider.  She’s a nurse, working from home and visiting customers from time to time. At the same time, Amani works at a local hospital to be able to supplement her income. 

And as she wants to better develop her business and improve her work as well, she decided to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed nursing tools and supplies. This Kiva loan will also allow her to better serve her clients and thus improve her income by minimum of 20%. This is how she works every day to make her greatest dream a reality and have a bigger business.

loans.use: to purchase the needed nursing tools and supplies.

loans.name: Sulkhan

texts.en:
Sulkhan is from Tskaltubo district of West Georgia. He is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children (three and five years old). The family earns their living through agricultural activities. In particular, Sulkhan runs a small dairy farm of two heifers and a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold to wholesalers. Beside this, the family sows greens on the open ground and does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested greens are sold at the local open market. Sulkhan is a very hard-working young man, with a great desire to get ahead.

He requested a loan to purchase an additional milk cow. After the number of cattle is ncreased, Sulkhan will receive more milk for his dairy and sell more cheese. This will significantly increase the family's income and the family will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 34-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with four children who are between 5 and 12 years old. Irene and her husband are engaged in fishing and farming seaweed to sustain the needs of their family. She is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy straw, wooden stakes and gasoline. When these are available, it will be easier for both of them to work hard and aim to be productive in their endeavor.

In the future, she hopes to continue sending her children to school for their better future.

loans.use: to buy straw, wooden stakes and gasoline

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 47-year-old married man and father of two children. He has owned a shop for car maintenance specializing in balancing and changing oil since 2002. He has 35 years of experience in his business, which provides him with the customers' trust and support. His work is his only source of income, which is why he works hard to improve it. He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for five cycles with a good pay back history.

Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy new, improved tools for his business and more oil.
 
He hopes to keep on expanding his business and providing his family with a happy life.

loans.use: to buy new, improved tools and more oil for his business

loans.name: Visetacion

texts.en:
Visetacion is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of two children ages 16 and 14. Visetacion is engaged in a food vending business selling cooked foods to the people in her community in San Miguel, Bohol.

Visetacion wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy cooking ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasoning, cooking oil and other items. Through this, she will be able to cook more food to sell.

In the future, Visetacion dreams of improving her business and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasoning, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal, age 40, is married to a teacher and they have two children who both attend school. She sells both used shoes and second hand clothes. She would like to get a loan to add more shoes and clothes for the business. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 33-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three school-aged children. He is the main income provider of the family and works very hard to be able to handle the heavy living expenses. He certainly gets huge support from his wife who also works at a local company. She has been involved in this occupation since 2009.  As for Mohammad, he has owned an aluminum shop. He earned great experience and started to manage his own business two years ago.  He is specialized in completing aluminum work. With his requested loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase the needed materials such as aluminum and start his new project properly. This will definitely allow him to achieve his work competently and be able to present good quality services to the clients.  He works on a freelance basis and hopes to take bigger projects and increase his earning in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as aluminum for his next project

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old and married with one child. She is a poultry farmer who sells eggs and chicken. She has been farming for five years and is a very hardworking lady. 

She hopes to grow her business to greater heights. She requests a loan of 21,363 KES to buy chick mash.

loans.use: to buy chick mash

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en: Leoncia is a 37-year-old married woman with six children.  The oldest child is 23 and the youngest is 8 years old. She is engaged in a food vending business. She sells items like home cooked viands such as fried fish, chicken adobo, and vegetable recipes like pinakbet (meat vegetable stew) to the people in her community. She usually earns about 4,000 PHP per month with her business. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP  to buy more ingredients such as vegetables, chicken, rice, and meat. In the future, Leoncia hopes to expand her business to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, and rice

loans.name: Vinda

texts.en: Vinda is a 43 year old  married woman from Albur, Bohol. She has seven children.The oldest child is twenty two while the youngest is four. She is engaged in calamay making. Calamay is a sticky sweet delicacy that is popular in many regions of the Philippines. It is made of coconut milk, brown sugar, and ground glutinous rice. She has been in the calamay business for twenty years. She requested a loan of 12,000 to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, brown sugar, and plastic canister. In the future, Vinda would like invest in other ventures to support the schooling of her children

loans.use: to buy glutinous rice, brown sugar, and plastic canister

loans.name: Padmalaya Group

texts.en:
The name of this group is Padmalaya. This group was formed in the year 2008 by four women members of the Below Poverty Line category from the village Torli in the district of Nuapada in Odisha, India. Nuapada district is one of the poorest districts in India. 

Santoshini is one of the members of this group. She is standing second from left in the photo. She is very shy by nature but has a strong determination for the development of her family. She is 35 years old, living with her husband, one baby son and three daughters, ages 10, 7 and 3 years old. Her two daughters are attending school in the same village. She has a little patch of land where her husband cultivates vegetables. 

Santoshini is running a milk business with three cows. She purchased two cows – one from each of two previous loans from Mahashakti Foundation. Santoshini is getting 15 liters of milk per day. Her husband supplies this milk to a Tiffin hotel in a nearby town. Her family earns 5,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from the present milk business. To maintain a family of six members along with maintenance of the cows, the present income is insufficient, and Santoshini is facing lots of financial trouble. So, as there is growing demand for milk in the locality, she has planned to utilize the present loan for purchasing another cow of improved variety to add some extra income for her family. 

Santoshini is very much thankful to Mahashakti Foundation for her growth. She says this will help her to earn some extra income and save some money to provide better education for her children. Santoshini also has a dream of developing a dairy farm in the future and constructing a cow shed.

The other three members of this group are Sabitri, Sabita and Lochana. They run a cloth business, electrical motor winding center and grocery shop.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a cow of improved variety.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is a 27-year-old married woman from Albur, Bohol. She has four children ages ten, seven, five, and one year old. She is engaged in 'Calamay' making. Calamay is made of glutinous rice, coconut milk and brown sugar. When she was seven years old, she helped her family in making calamay. When she got married, she continued making calamay and today it is the source of her livelihood. 

Rosalyn requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, brown sugar, and a plastic canister. In the future, Rosalyn would like to invest in another business to support her family as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy glutinous rice, brown sugar, and a plastic canister

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is a 39 year old married woman and a mother of two young children from  Bien Unido, Bohol. Anabella has been engaged in fishing business for more than three years now. Her husband works as fisherman.

Anabella is asking for a loan to buy additional fishing materials such as fish nets, buckets, lead weights and others. Through this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Anabella dreams of improving their livelihood and saves money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials such as fish nets, buckets, lead weights and others

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 50 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.
Thelma works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase boxes of fish to sell retail.
Thelma has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Thelma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell retail.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.en: Sixto has been an active member of PMPC since 2011.  He is 54 years of age, widowed, and has six children. Four of them are adults, and two are still minors. He lives in Canghunoghunog, Siquijor, Siquijor. He engages in selling farm products, such as vegetables, root crops, and spices. He earns 2,500 PHP per month from the business. He took a loan from PMPC, to purchase more vegetables, root crops, and spices to resell, hoping to increase his income, to save for the future of his minor children.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables, root crops, and spices for resale

loans.name: Rumilda

texts.es:
La señora Rumilda vive con sus 2 hijos en la ciudad de Ybycui.  Ella cuenta que para poder empezar este negocio tuvo que viajar a Argentina a trabajar, fue ahí donde le conoció a quien iba a ser su marido, al cabo de los años se casaron y trabajaron juntos para ahorrar y así regresar a su país a poner un negocio para poder vivir en armonía con sus hijos.
Actualmente tiene una despensa, el cual es el punto de referencia para las compras de la zona, ya que presta un buen servicio. El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de productos de consumo masivo y bebidas en general, ya que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rumilda lives with her two children in the city of Ybycui. She says that in order to start with this business she had to travel to Argentina and work there. There she met the man who would become her husband. They got married, worked and saved some money in order to be able to return to their country, start a business and live happily with their children.

She has now a grocery store, which is a reference point for everybody in the region because of the good service.

The requested loan will be used to buy consumer goods and beverages, now that the holidays are approaching.

loans.use: to buy consumer goods and beverages.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dry goods business. Edna is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food production business

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa was born in 1976. She has two children who are learning at secondary school and high school. Her husband sells fresh fruits. Thoa sells poultry meats to earn a living. She makes 4,000,000 dong (VND) a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,500,000 VND per month. 

Thoa has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy food for chickens and ducks to raise, then sell them in the market. Her dream is to let her children have good careers and enlarge her poultry meat store.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and ducks to raise, then sell them in the market.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 48 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mercedes has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Mercedes requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase new tools, clothing and other equipment for her tailoring business. Mercedes has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Mercedes would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase new tools, clothing and other equipment

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Isabel tiene 45 años, vive en la Ciudad de Itá, está separada, pero logró criar a sus 3 hijos sola.
La señora Isabel tiene una despensa bien surtida, además tiene 3 vacas y un novillo, es una persona muy sacrificada y responsable y está saliendo adelante por medio de su sacrificio. Gracias a su trabajo ha dado a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
 Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, frutas, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás. Cuenta que su meta es poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y seguir ganando clientela.
texts.en:
Isabel is 45 years old. She lives in the city of Itá. SHe is separated but was able to raise 3 children on her own. Isabel has a well stocked store as well as 3 cows and a young bull. She is a hardworking and responsible person who is getting ahead with her hard work. Thanks to her work, she has given her children what they need to have a dignified life without deprivation.

She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, fruit, dairy products, baked goods and more. She says that her goal is to be able to keep growing with her business and keep gaining customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, beverages, dairy products, baked goods and more.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El señor Abelardo tiene 39 años, es casado, vive en la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 2 hijos, uno mayor de edad y otro menor. Se dedica a la fabricación de ropas y venta de calzados, con el transcurso del tiempo y con sacrificio pudo montar su taller de costura sin medio de transporte.
Hoy en día cuenta con una Camioneta Tipo Furgón con el cual realiza la distribución de sus prendas y calzados. El Señor  cuenta que por medio de su trabajo y sacrificio está sacando adelante a su familia y dándoles todo lo que necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de calzados, para poder seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Abelardo is 39 years old. He is married and lives in the city of Villarrica. He has 2 children, one grown and the other a minor. He works making clothes and selling shoes. Over time and with sacrfice he has been able to open a sewing workshop without transportation. 

Now he has a van with which he distributes his clothes and shoes. He says that through his work and sacrfice he is getting his family ahead and giving them everything they need.

He is asking for this loan to buy shoes to keep filling the orders his customers make.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Asamt

texts.en:
Ms Asamt is a 40-year-old married woman. Asamt is an active and talented lady who excels in the work of stitching. She has six years of experience in this field and she has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Asamt wants to fulfill the needs of her family through all her hard work.  

Asamt requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy a new stitching machine with spools of thread, buttons and zippers in different colors to meet up with the increasing demand without delay. With the purchase of a new machine, her daughter would assist her in completing orders on time. She dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is currently living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: To buy a new stitching machine with spools of thread, buttons and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La Sra. Feliciana tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos. Tiene un Autoservicio bien surtido, bien equipado, local propio, casa propia, en la cuidad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Se inició con una  mercería, y después aumentó de rubro, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya bien formada por su antigüedad.
Solicita el crédito para las compras de productos, como ser bebidas, prendas, comestibles, y demás, ya que quiere seguir surtiéndose, para poder dar la variedad a la que están acostumbrados sus clientes.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She has a well-stocked, self-service store in a location she owns, as well as her own house, located in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.

Feliciana began her business with a notions store selling knick-knacks, but later she shifted to a bigger area of retail. So far, it has gone very well for her. Over the years, she has built a loyal, dependable customer base.

Feliciana is requesting this loan in order to buy drinks, garments, food items, and other merchandise so that she can continue to stock her store well. This way, she will offer a better variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, garments, food items, and more.

loans.name: Creciendo Contigo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Creciendo Contigo” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de perfume, venta ropa, almacén, venta de pan amasado, artesanía, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Linares.
Guido, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste chaleco de color café, su cabello lo usa corto y es de color blanco y usa barba.
El se dedica al rubro de venta de verduras desde hace 3 años. Comenta que además de vender verduras, vende frambuesas, fardos y venta de animales, trabaja de forma independiente y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en diferentes locales y supermercados donde encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito Una de las metas de Guido es crecer en su rubro y dar la posibilidad de trabajo a otras personas que lo necesiten.
Guido por el momento vive solo. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es crecer, ser un gran empresario, y  a nivel personal tener buena salud para continuar con su rubro.
El está muy contento y agradecido de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Además comenta que el grupo del cual forma parte existe muy buena comunicación.
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Thtis communal bank is called “Creciendo Contigo” [Growing WIth You]. It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different areas. among htem are: selling pperfume, selling clothes, a store, selling bread, artisan crafts, services, and more. All of them are from the city of Linares.

Guido is a member of the communal bank. He is standing in the second  row in the photo, the first one on the left, wearing a brown sweater. His hair is short and white and he has a beard. He has worked selling vegetables for 3 years. He says that besides selling vegetables, he sells rasberries, hay and animals. He works for himself and arranges his schedule according to availability. 

The merchandise and materials that he needs he buys in different locales and suprtmarkets where he can find low cost merchandise, so it is convenient financially. With the loan, one of Guido's goals is to grow in his line of work and have the possibility of giving other people work that they need. 

At this time, Guido lives alone. His dreams for his work are to grow, be a great businessman, and for his personal life to stay healthy and continue in this area. He is very happy and grateful to the help offered by Fondo Esperanza, since this will allow him to invest in his business. He remarks that the trainings have been fundamental for his business and also for his personal development, because he has learned to organize and distribute his income and investments better. He also says that the group he is a member of has very good communication.

Linares is an important urban center in the region of Maule, located in the central area of the country. In this area there is agriculture and wine producing that excels in export. The cultivation of grains also stands out (rice, wheat, corn and oats) as well as vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, swiss chard and legumes) and fruit. Linares is the province where the most rice is produced in Chile. In fact, 78% of the national production of this grain is in this province, especially in the area of Parral.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to stock his business.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 39 year old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and their three children who are all in school. Both Rima and her husband collaborate together in order to pay their family expenses and their children’s educational fees. Rima has been working independently as a babysitter since 2005. 

She visits her customers at home and also welcomes some of them at her place. Her husband has been working in a local company since 1990. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase some nursery products related to her business. This Kiva loan will facilitate her work and allow her attract additional customers. In the future, she plans to open her own nursery.

loans.use: to purchase some nursery products related to her business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, tiene la edad  de 41 años, está casada,  vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito quiere comprar  materiales como telas  para la fabricación de ropa y utensilios de vestir para su posterior venta. Ella actualmente realiza sus confecciones para una empresa que le compra sus trabajos llamada ´´Creaciones y Distribuciones A y C´´. Ella con este crédito quiere implementar mas innovación en sus trabajos y así poderle dar a sus compradores una amplia gama de productos nuevos y decorados  para las nuevas tendencias en el mercado. Ella espera poderle sacar  al proyecto el máximo de ganancias para lograr una mejor estabilidad económica y a su vez ayudar con los gastos del hogar para así poder tener un futuro económica cada vez mejor. Además este es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja para fortalecer su proyecto y surgir como una mujer emprendedora de negocios.
texts.en:
Raquel is 41 years old. She is married and lives with her 3 children and husband who are her biggest priority. With this loan she wants to buy materials, such as fabric, to make clothes and other items to sell. At the moment a company called "Creaciones y Distribuciones A y C" buys what she makes. With this loan she wants to be more innovative in her work and in this way provide her buyers with a wider range of new products and accessories to meet new market trends. 

She hopes to maximise the profits she earns from this initiative so as to become more financially stable. She also hopes to be able to help with the household bills in order to have a better economic future. This is the first loan that she will receive from FUDECOSUR. She has never received a loan from a state bank before. However, FUDECOSUR has offered her the possibility of a loan with better facilities and with a very low rate of interest. With this money she will be able to secure this initiative and forge ahead as a enterprising business woman.

loans.use: To buy mateials to make clothes

loans.name: Millaray Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Millaray” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta  de productos de belleza, almacén, botillería, costuras, hojalatería, panadería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Rita, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste pantalón y polera de color negro, usa cartera de color negra, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de provisiones al por menor, desde hace 3 años. Comenta que tiene su pequeño negocio en su casa, trabaja todos los días y su horario es de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, a veces le ayudan sus hijas y su marido.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en diferentes supermercados donde encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará abarrotes, bebidas, helados, harina, azúcar, te, confort.
Una de las metas de Rita es crecer con su negocio y llegar a tener un minimarket, para tener más clientela y mayores ingresos, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Rita vive junto a su esposo y tres hijas de 28, 20 y 12 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral cuidar y crecer en su negocio, y sacar adelante a sus hijas con sus estudios para que sean unas grandes profesionales el dia de mañana.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank, named "Millaray", is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who are dedicated to different sectors, including clothing sales, beauty product sales, bulk sales, liquor sales, sewing, a body shop, a bakery, the service industry, and more. All of its members are from the city of Chillán.

Rita is the member of this group pictured above, standing in the first row, in the first spot from the right. She has dark brown hair and is wearing pants and a black shirt, holding a black purse, which she is pictured using. Rita has worked in her own small retail shop for three years. She runs her business out of her own house and works every day of the week. With this business, she is able to arrange her work schedule according to her availability, which allows her to attend to her husband and daughters. She buys merchandise to stock her store from different supermarkets, depending on where she finds the best prices.

With this loan, Rita will buy groceries, drinks, ice cream, flour, sugar, tea, and comfort. One of Rita's goals is to expand her business and open a mini-market in order to serve more customers and generate more earnings. Then she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

Rita lives with her husband and three daughters, ages 28, 20, and 12. She dreams of growing her business and helping her family get ahead. She hopes to educate her daughters so that they will become tomorrow's professionals. 

Rita is very pleased and grateful for the opportunity offered to her by Fondo Esperanza because this loan will allow her to invest in her business. She says that the trainings Fondo Esperanza offers have been very beneficial for her business as well as her personal development since she has learned to get organized and better distribute her income and investments. Rita is also pleased with the communication she has with her communal bank group.

Chillán is a town in the south-central zone of Chile. Its name means “silla del sol” or "seat of the sun" in Mapudungun, an indigenous language of the Mapuches. Chillán is known as “Cuna de la Patria” (Cradle of the Motherland) o “Tierra de Artistas” (Land of the Artists) because in this city, many distinguished persons in Chile's history were born, for example, the pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks, ice cream, flour, sugar, tea, and comfort.

loans.name: Stellamaris

texts.en:
Stellamaris is 40 years old, married, and has three children. She is a horticultural farmer and also owns a food stall. She has been farming for the last ten years and is very hardworking. 

She has grown tremendously since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, and has been able to care for her family.

She wishes to have a large-scale farming business, and add other horticultural products on her farm. She requests a loan of 20,000 KES to increase stock for her food stall.

loans.use: to increase stock for her food stall.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22 year-old-man living in Lebanon. He’s single, living with his parents and six siblings. Being a big family is not that easy, especially nowadays after facing crucial financial problems. This is the reason why the family members cooperate together, hoping to enhance their status financially. 

One of Ahmad’s greatest dreams is to be able to cover his university fees. He works at a local company, and still, his salary does not cover his study fees. To help him continue paying his education fees, he’s asking to take a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. 

With this loan, he will achieve a good educational level, even pursue higher degrees. With this education, he will start his own business and no doubt a new and better way of living.

loans.use: paying his education fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, neither of whom attends school. She is not looking after any other family member.

She has been running a beauty salon that she rents, working seven days a week. She also sells fruits as an additional source of income.

Sylvia has requested for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to increase her stock of hair and skin oils, hair extensions and weaves. Her challenges include seasonality and intermittent electricity failures. Her dream is to be the best beautician in the area and to modernize her salon. She joined MCDT because she wanted self development. She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expense is her rent.

loans.use: to buy more skin oil, hair extensions and weaves.

loans.name: Perezi

texts.en:
Perezi is 37 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, 2 of whom are currently in school. For the past 6 years, Perezi has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, books and ghee.

To help expand his business, Perezi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more commodities, such as maize flour and sugar, allowing Perezi to generate greater profits and be able to satisfy his customers. Perezi hopes that in the future he will be able to move from retail into wholesale. 

Perezi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Perezi  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more commodities, such as maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Ismaelita

texts.en: Ismaelita is a 33-year-old mother of three children from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married to a pastor. She is engaged in selling products from the Personal Collection company. Her business started 5 months ago and has helped in raising her children, who are 1, 4 and 6. She is asking for a loan to buy lotion, cologne and household cleaning agents. She works hard so she can send her children to school and offer them a brighter future. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and offer more affordable products and cosmetics from different companies.

loans.use: to buy lotion, cologne and household cleaning agents.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family members.

She has been selling onions and tomatoes in the market at retail for two years, working six days a week. She has no other source of income.

She has requested for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more onions and tomatoes for sale. Her challenges include seasonality of supply, thieves and transportation. Her dream is to expand her business and make profits that can meet all her needs and also to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because she wanted more capital for her business. She rents a house with no access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in Kabwohe, Uganda. She is  and has 4 children, 2 of whom are currently in school. For the past 9 years, Jeanette has been working hard to manage her retail store, which sells jelly, soap and sugar. 

To help expand her business, Jeanette has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more commodities like sugar and soap to sell, allowing Jeanette to generate greater profits and pay for her children's education.
